arm_group.description: Early oral feeding starting with liquids on postoperative day (POD) 1, followed by a soft diet on POD 2, and solid foods on day 3
Delayed oral feeding starting with liquids on postoperative day (POD) 4, followed by a soft diet on POD 5, and solid foods on day 6

brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of this study is to evaluate the possibility of shortening postoperative hospital
      stay after gastrectomy by early oral feeding as a component of an enhanced recovery protocol
      (ERAS).

clinical_study.brief_title: Early Oral Feeding After Total Gastrectomy for Cancer

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Total gastrectomy for cancer

          -  Age 18 - 80 years

          -  Informed consent

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Numerous hepatic and peritoneal metastases

          -  Extended resections (pancreas, colon)

          -  Preoperative malnutrition requiring total parenteral nutrition

          -  Emergency surgery

intervention.description: Oral fluids starting on POD 1, followed by a soft diet (thin purée six times a day) on day 2, and regular solid diet thereafter

facility.name: First Department of Surgery, Jagiellonian University Medical College

clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized Clinical Trial of Early Oral Feeding as a Component of Accelerated Recovery Protocol After Total Gastrectomy for Cancer

other_outcome.description: Hospital readmissions within 30 days after discharge
Time to reach oral feeding covering 75% of patient's requirements
other_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay, an expected average of 8 days

other_outcome.description: Quality of life measured by EORTC QLQ-C30 and EORTC QLQ - STO22
other_outcome.time_frame: Preoperatively, postoperative day 7, 14 days after discharge

other_outcome.description: Laboratory tests, including lymphocyte count, blood albumin, blood prealbumin

overall_official.affiliation: First Department of Surgery, Jagiellonian University Medical College, Krakow, Poland

oversight_info.authority: Poland: Ministry of Science and Higher Education

primary_outcome.description: Time between surgery and patient discharge
primary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay, an expected average of 8 days

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Any complication occurring during hospital stay
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Participants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay, an expected average of 8 days

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label
